Reaction Types.title: Chemical Reaction Types
Reaction Types.content:
Welcome, young alchemist!

In this realm, you shall master the five fundamental reaction types:

• Synthesis: When elements unite (A + B → AB)
• Decomposition: When compounds break apart (AB → A + B)
• Single Replacement: When one element takes another's place
• Double Replacement: When partners exchange
• Combustion: When substances burn with oxygen

Remember: Balance is key to all magical transformations!

Examples:
• 2H₂ + O₂ → 2H₂O (Synthesis)
• 2H₂O → 2H₂ + O₂ (Decomposition)
• Zn + CuSO₄ → ZnSO₄ + Cu (Single Replacement)
• AgNO₃ + NaCl → AgCl + NaNO₃ (Double Replacement)
• CH₄ + 2O₂ → CO₂ + 2H₂O (Combustion)

Gas Reactions.title: The Mysteries of Gases
Gas Reactions.content:
Behold the ethereal nature of gases!

Gas laws govern the invisible forces:

• Boyle's Law: Pressure and volume dance inversely (PV = k)
• Charles' Law: Temperature and volume rise together (V/T = k)
• Gay-Lussac's Law: Pressure and temperature unite (P/T = k)
• Avogadro's Principle: Equal volumes, equal molecules
• Ideal Gas Law: PV = nRT

Master these principles to control the very air!

Applications:
• Breathing and lungs follow Boyle's Law
• Hot air balloons use Charles' Law
• Pressure cookers apply Gay-Lussac's Law
• Standard Temperature and Pressure (STP): 0°C, 1 atm

Basic Stoichiometry.title: The Art of Chemical Calculations
Basic Stoichiometry.content:
Learn the ancient art of measuring chemical quantities!

Key Concepts:

• Mole: Avogadro's number (6.022 × 10²³) of particles
• Molar Mass: Mass of one mole of substance (g/mol)
• Stoichiometric Ratios: Relationships from balanced equations
• Limiting Reactant: The ingredient that runs out first
• Theoretical Yield: Maximum possible product
• Percent Yield: Actual yield / Theoretical yield × 100%

Master these calculations to predict potion outcomes!

Example Problem:
2H₂ + O₂ → 2H₂O
If you have 4 moles H₂ and 1 mole O₂, how much H₂O can you make?
Answer: 2 moles H₂O (limited by O₂)

Random Mix.title: The Chaos Curriculum
Random Mix.content:
Prepare for anything, young wizard!

In this challenge, all knowledge converges:

• Any reaction type may appear
• All principles are fair game
• Quick thinking is essential
• Trust your training

May fortune favor the prepared mind!

Review all concepts:
• Balancing equations
• Reaction types
• Gas laws
• Stoichiometry
• Periodic trends
• Chemical bonding

Stay alert and ready for surprises!

Functional Groups.title: The Building Blocks of Life
Functional Groups.content:
Discover the mystical functional groups!

Major Functional Groups:

• Alkanes: Single bonds only (C-C, C-H)
• Alkenes: Double bonds (C=C)
• Alkynes: Triple bonds (C≡C)
• Alcohols: Hydroxyl group (-OH)
• Aldehydes: Carbonyl at end (-CHO)
• Ketones: Carbonyl in middle (C=O)
• Carboxylic Acids: -COOH group
• Esters: -COO- linkage
• Amines: Nitrogen-containing (-NH₂)
• Ethers: Oxygen bridge (R-O-R)

Each group has unique properties and reactions.

Naming Patterns:
• -ane (alkanes), -ene (alkenes), -yne (alkynes)
• -ol (alcohols), -al (aldehydes), -one (ketones)
• -oic acid (carboxylic acids)

Basic Organic Reactions.title: Organic Alchemy
Basic Organic Reactions.content:
The magic of carbon compounds!

Organic reactions shape life itself:

• Addition: Bonds break, new ones form (alkenes → alkanes)
• Substitution: One group replaces another
• Elimination: Creating double bonds (alcohols → alkenes)
• Oxidation: Adding oxygen or removing hydrogen
• Reduction: Adding hydrogen or removing oxygen
• Polymerization: Small molecules join to form chains

Reaction Types:
• Combustion: Organic + O₂ → CO₂ + H₂O
• Hydration: Alkene + H₂O → Alcohol
• Dehydration: Alcohol → Alkene + H₂O
• Esterification: Acid + Alcohol → Ester + H₂O

Carbon chains hold infinite possibilities!

Example: CH₂=CH₂ + H₂O → CH₃CH₂OH (Hydration)

Stereochemistry.title: The Dance of Molecular Shapes
Stereochemistry.content:
Explore the three-dimensional world of molecules!

Key Concepts:

• Chirality: Molecules with handedness
• Enantiomers: Non-superimposable mirror images
• Optical Activity: Rotation of polarized light
• R/S Configuration: Systematic naming of stereocenters
• E/Z Isomerism: Geometric isomers of alkenes
• Fischer Projections: 2D representations of 3D molecules

Importance:
• Drug activity often depends on stereochemistry
• One enantiomer may be beneficial, the other harmful
• Enzymes are highly stereoselective

Rules:
• Assign priorities by atomic number
• R = clockwise, S = counterclockwise
• E = opposite sides, Z = same side

The shape of molecules determines their magical properties!

Random Mix.title: The Organic Synthesis Challenge
Random Mix.content:
Master the art of organic transformation!

Prepare for comprehensive organic chemistry:

• Functional group identification
• Reaction mechanisms
• Stereochemistry problems
• Synthesis planning
• Spectroscopy interpretation

Skills to master:
• Recognizing reaction patterns
• Predicting products
• Designing synthetic routes
• Understanding mechanisms

Key strategies:
• Work backwards from target molecule
• Identify key bond formations
• Consider functional group compatibility
• Plan protecting group strategies

Organic synthesis is both art and science!

Amino Acids and Proteins.title: The Molecules of Life
Amino Acids and Proteins.content:
Discover the building blocks of living beings!

Amino Acids:

• 20 standard amino acids
• Essential vs. non-essential
• Structure: amino group, carboxyl group, side chain
• Classification by side chain properties:
  - Polar (hydrophilic)
  - Nonpolar (hydrophobic)
  - Charged (positive/negative)
  - Special (glycine, proline, cysteine)

Protein Structure:
• Primary: amino acid sequence
• Secondary: α-helices and β-sheets
• Tertiary: 3D folding
• Quaternary: multiple protein subunits

Protein Functions:
• Enzymes (catalysis)
• Structure (collagen, keratin)
• Transport (hemoglobin)
• Defense (antibodies)
• Hormones (insulin)

Protein folding determines function!

Enzyme Kinetics.title: The Catalysts of Life
Enzyme Kinetics.content:
Master the magic of biological catalysts!

Enzyme Properties:

• Lower activation energy
• Increase reaction rate
• Remain unchanged after reaction
• Highly specific for substrates
• Activity affected by temperature and pH

Michaelis-Menten Kinetics:
• Km: substrate concentration at ½ Vmax
• Vmax: maximum reaction velocity
• kcat: turnover number
• kcat/Km: catalytic efficiency

Enzyme Inhibition:
• Competitive: competes with substrate
• Non-competitive: binds at different site
• Uncompetitive: binds only to enzyme-substrate complex
• Irreversible: permanent modification

Factors Affecting Enzyme Activity:
• Temperature (optimal ~37°C for human enzymes)
• pH (each enzyme has optimal pH)
• Substrate concentration
• Presence of inhibitors or activators

Metabolic Pathways.title: The Rivers of Cellular Energy
Metabolic Pathways.content:
Navigate the complex networks of cellular chemistry!

Major Pathways:

• Glycolysis: Glucose → Pyruvate (cytoplasm)
• Citric Acid Cycle: Pyruvate → CO₂ (mitochondria)
• Electron Transport: NADH → ATP (mitochondria)
• Gluconeogenesis: Non-glucose → Glucose
• Fatty Acid Oxidation: Fats → Acetyl-CoA
• Fatty Acid Synthesis: Acetyl-CoA → Fats

Key Molecules:
• ATP: Universal energy currency
• NADH/NAD+: Electron carriers
• FADH₂/FAD: Electron carriers
• Acetyl-CoA: Central metabolite
• Glucose: Primary fuel

Regulation:
• Allosteric control
• Covalent modification
• Enzyme induction/repression
• Compartmentalization

Metabolism is the chemistry of life itself!

Random Mix.title: The Biochemical Mastery Test
Random Mix.content:
Prove your command of life's chemistry!

Comprehensive biochemistry knowledge:

• Protein structure and function
• Enzyme mechanisms and kinetics
• Metabolic pathway integration
• Membrane structure and transport
• DNA/RNA structure and function
• Signal transduction
• Regulation mechanisms

Skills to demonstrate:
• Connecting structure to function
• Understanding regulatory mechanisms
• Predicting metabolic effects
• Analyzing experimental data
• Integrating multiple pathways

Areas of focus:
• Thermodynamics of biological processes
• Enzyme-substrate interactions
• Metabolic flux control
• Cellular signaling cascades
• Genetic information flow

Biochemistry unifies all life sciences!
